alert.note: Alert for Pierce (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 08 at 6:58PM CDT until May 08 at 7:15PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN PIERCE COUNTY... At 658 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 6 miles north of Frontenac, or 11 miles east of Red Wing, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Pierce County. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
